page.description: Gets the current record's logical position in the current sort order
page.original:
&ltTBL>.LOGICALRECORD_GET() Syntax Recno as N = &ltTBL>.LOGICALRECORD_GET() Description The &ltTBL>.LOGICALRECORD_GET() method returns the current record's logical position in the current sort order. Example dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.open("customer") tbl.fetch_first() ui_msg_box("First record", "The first record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.fetch_next() ui_msg_box("Next record", "The next record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) query.order = "customer->Lastname" inx = tbl.query_create() tbl.fetch_first() ui_msg_box("First record", "The first record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.fetch_next() ui_msg_box("Next record", "The next record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.close()
See Also <TBL>.LOGICALRECORD_SET()
